page.title: 04 Life in Slipton (Part 2)
page.content: Most of the people who live here work in Kettering and they travel by car. People shop in Kettering mostly - usually once per week. A bus travels to Kettering at 07.50 each weekday and comes back through Slipton at 16.46. On Saturdays the bus leaves for Kettering at 09.06 and comes back at 13.31. There is also one bus into Thrapston and back again on Tuesday morning. These are single decker pay-as-you enter buses owned mainly by United Counties. The children go to Cranford Primary School and travel by bus. At the age of 11 they go to secondary schools in Kettering. Very few children live in Slipton. No changes have taken place in recent years. There is a fete each year. There is one public telephone box and one post box in the village.
